intro: Myrrhis maculata, commonly known as spotted cow-wheat, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Myrrhis maculata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a valuable component of ecological habitats.
